instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board power on but fan noise continuously
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board power on but fan noise continuously.....what should check exactly ? with ASD test heatsink has problem , but i can not find anything. help me please

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board power on but fan noise continuously
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What is the full error message reported in ASD?
Only one error appears?
If you can boot into macOS, run HWMonitor and post strange values.

Check exact voltage for <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> w/ and w/o keyboard connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board power on but fan noise continuously
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> voltage is normal
i can not run hw monitor because system is very slow , with other system also , is it graphics problem ?
asd report sumitted below ....
many many tnx for your reply....[ATTACH alt="<SIGNAL>PHOTO_2021</SIGNAL>-03-<SIGNAL>04_22</SIGNAL>-30-06.jpg"]59740[/ATTACH] @
[B][USER=682]2informaticos[/USER][/B]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board power on but fan noise continuously
threads.message:
Please, do NOT queote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.

That is old board, run ASD and post entire error message.
You should get more specific information about that sensor.
It is probably Battery Charger Proximity, but ASD will clarify that.
It is included on the trackpad board.
So you should try known good trackpad board/flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board power on but fan noise continuously
threads.message: me submitted an image of ASD report allready... ? you saw it ? if no i will submit again . THANKS

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board power on but fan noise continuously
threads.message:
I said ASD, not AHT.
However, test known good trackpad board/flex.
